text: Charilaou () is a district in eastern Thessaloniki, Greece. Papanastasiou Street It took its name from the banker Epameinontas Charilaos, a landowner in the area. It is densely built-up and located above the Dépôt area and near Toumba and Pylaia. Its main street is Papanastasiou Street where is also located Kleanthis Vikelidis Stadium. In the area there is also the large park of "Nea Elvetia", such as the old ceramics factory of the Allatini's. == Streets == * Allatini Street * Papanastasiou Street * Voulgari Street ==People== * Akis Petretzikis, chef == Sport Clubs == {|class="wikitable" |- !colspan="4"|Notable sport clubs based in Charilaou |- !width="150"|Club !Founded !Sports !Achievements |- |Aris Thessaloniki||1914||Multi sports||Panhellenic titles in football, basketball, volleyball, waterpolo.
